title: Great motivator app
text:
I found it difficult to figure out the proper amount of certain exercises and I gave up on certain workouts before. Once I started using this app I found that all I had to do was remind myself to complete specific workouts each day, stay on pace with the videos, and I would be fine. 

The app lets you go at your own pace which is great compared to working out in a group where you have to keep up with everyone else. Eventually you can increase the intensity as you see fit. The hardest part of doing the workout is finding the motivation to start it, but this app uses a similar system to Duolingo which is great at keeping you hooked. Great app overall! There‚Äôs plenty you can get done with just the free version.

title: Difficulty rankings limits are gone
text:
Here‚Äôs your text corrected while keeping your original wording:

‚ÄúI used this app before, and by default, you used to have the ability to increase the difficulty to be as hard as possible or as easy as possible, but it had a limit‚Äîunless I‚Äôm tripping, because this is mind-straining and confusing. I press ‚Äòeasy‚Äô and ‚Äòeasy,‚Äô but it still doesn‚Äôt make it easier. Sometimes, the ‚Äòeasy‚Äô doesn‚Äôt make any sense at all; one has 10 exercises, then the next ‚Äòeasy‚Äô has 12 exercises, then 14. What happened to the limits on how easy or hard you can make it? Make it make sense. If you‚Äôre going to have an ‚Äòeasy‚Äô option, make it easy to the point that you can‚Äôt make it any easier. If you‚Äôre going to make it limitless, then make ‚Äòhard‚Äô super intense or ‚Äòeasy‚Äô super simple‚Äîdon‚Äôt mix it up. And when I say make something harder, don‚Äôt make it easier than the previous ‚Äòharder‚Äô five times.‚Äù

Here‚Äôs your text with corrected grammar, keeping your exact words:

‚ÄúYes, I honestly used ChatGPT to correct my grammar before I send this using the exact words I used, but unless I‚Äôm tripping, maybe there is some way to make limited easy and hard options appear, because that would be cool.
